Job__08.1: The Baldad the Suhite answered, and said:
Job__08.2: How long wilt thou speak these things, and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
Job__08.3: Doth God pervert judgment, or doth the Almighty overthrow that which is just?
Job__08.4: Although thy children have sinned against him, and he hath left them in the hand of their iniquity:
Job__08.5: Yet if thou wilt arise early to God, and wilt beseech the Almighty:
Job__08.6: If thou wilt walk clean and upright, he will presently awake onto thee, and will make the dwelling of thy justice peaceable:
Job__08.7: Insomuch, that if thy former things were small, thy latter things would be multiplied exceedingly.
Job__08.8: For inquire of the former generation, and search diligently into the memory of the fathers:
Job__08.9: (For we are but of yesterday, and are ignorant that our days upon earth are but a shadow:)
Job__08.10: And they shall teach thee: they shall speak to thee, and utter words out of their hearts.
Job__08.11: Can the rush be green without moisture? or a sedge-bush grow without water?
Job__08.12: When it is yet in flower, and is not plucked up with the hand, it withereth before all herbs.
Job__08.13: Even so are the ways of all that forget God, and the hope of the hypocrite shall perish:
Job__08.14: His folly shall not please him, and his trust shall be like the spider's web.
Job__08.15: He shall lean upon his house, and it shall not stand: he shall prop it up, and it shall not rise:
Job__08.16: He seemeth to have moisture before the sun cometh, and at his rising his blossom shall shoot forth.
Job__08.17: His roots shall be thick upon a heap of stones, and among the stones he shall abide.
Job__08.18: If one swallow him up out of his place, he shall deny him, and shall say: I know thee not.
Job__08.19: For this is the joy of his way, that others may spring again out of the earth.
Job__08.20: God will not cast away the simple, nor reach out his hand to the evildoer:
Job__08.21: Until thy mouth be filled with laughter, and thy lips with rejoicing.
Job__08.22: They that hate thee, shall be clothed with confusion: and the dwelling of the wicked shall not stand.
